history.content:
It really depends on yourself. I will be doing 61c+16b+data100 next semester and it's my maximum i guess considering the workload.

I'm taking 170 too, and I'd say that if you are comfortable with 170 and 61c, you probably would handle 16b+186, too.

children.subject: I don't think I've heard anyone that took 188 in recent 3-4 semesters said it's a lighter workload workload class, so swap 186 with that is not a good idea if you want a more manageable schedule. The thing with 186 is that it only have projects and short gradescope homework with instant feedback (at least that's the case when I took it in sp21), so I wouldn't say it's more work than data100.

history.content:
I'm thinking of taking ee16b and cs 186 with two non-techs next semester, and I'm wondering if that's going to be a lot of workload. Should I switch 186 out with data 100 or cs 188?

(Also, I did hear data 100 and cs 188 are both lighter workload classes, but do you think they're light enough that I could take both with ee16b? Or would it be not advisable if I'm taking a not-so-light humanities course?)

For reference, I'm taking cs 61c, cs 170, and data 8 right now, and I'm honestly not doing as well as I'd hoped (I'm a little behind in terms of keeping up to date with assignments with 61c and find 170 a little hard conceptually even though I like the topics, for instance. Data 8 is fine.)
history.subject: is taking ee16b + cs 186 a lot of workload?
